definitions.definition: The international mile : a unit of length precisely equal to 1.609344 kilometers established by treaty among Anglophone nations in 1959, divided into 5,280 feet or 1,760 yards .
examples: You need to go about three mile down the road.

definitions.definition: Any of several customary units of length derived from the 1593 English statute mile of 8 furlongs , equivalent to 5,280 feet or 1,760 yards of various precise values .
Any of many customary units of length derived from the Roman mile ( mille passus ) of 8 stades or 5,000 Roman feet .
The Scandinavian mile : a unit of length precisely equal to 10 kilometers defined in 1889.
Any of many customary units of length from other measurement systems of roughly similar values , as the Chinese mile or Arabic mile .
An airline mile in a frequent flyer program.

examples: The shot missed by a mile .

definitions.definition: A race of 1 mile's length ; a race of around 1 mile's length ( usually 1500 or 1600 meters )
examples: The runners competed in the mile .

definitions.definition: One mile per hour , as a measure of speed .
examples: five miles over the speed limit

main_definition: The international mile : a unit of length precisely equal to 1.609344 kilometers established by treaty among Anglophone nations in 1959, divided into 5,280 feet or 1,760 yards .
secondary_definitions: Any of several customary units of length derived from the 1593 English statute mile of 8 furlongs , equivalent to 5,280 feet or 1,760 yards of various precise values .
Any of many customary units of length derived from the Roman mile ( mille passus ) of 8 stades or 5,000 Roman feet .
The Scandinavian mile : a unit of length precisely equal to 10 kilometers defined in 1889.
Any of many customary units of length from other measurement systems of roughly similar values , as the Chinese mile or Arabic mile .
( travel ) An airline mile in a frequent flyer program.
( athletics ) A race of 1 mile's length ; a race of around 1 mile's length ( usually 1500 or 1600 meters )
( colloquial ) One mile per hour , as a measure of speed .
